isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON AIR SUSPENSION WITH TRAILING LEAF SPRINGS - MAIN SUPPORT MEMBER (Figure 11 ,Figure 12 andFigure 13 ) - INSTALL

step1.para: Position main support member on axle seat, or on spacer plate if so equipped, with main support member dowel pin guided into hole in axle seat or spacer plate. Delrin liner must be positioned on the top side of the main support member.

Install top pad, U-bolts, bottom cap washers and locknuts ( Figure 11). The torque rod mounting bolts of the bottom cap must be positioned toward the front of the vehicle. Do not tighten U-bolt nuts at this time.
Lower air spring mounting brackets while guiding bolts of air spring mounting brackets into main support members.
Install washers and locknuts which connect the air spring mounting brackets to the main support members. Tighten the locknuts to 220-300 ft-lbs. (298-406 N•m) ( Figure 12).
Lower frame so that frame hangers engage main support member. Air up the system and center the tip of the main support member between the frame hanger legs.
Tighten U-bolt locknuts to 260-300 ft-lbs. (352-406 N•m) ( Figure 12). Strike top of U-bolts with hammer and retorque nuts. Do not exceed specified torque on U-bolt locknuts.
Install rebound bolt, roller, washers and locknut in frame hangers as shown in Figure 13. Tighten locknut to 49-66 ft-lbs. (66-89 N•m).

note.para: Recheck axle alignment after installation of new support members. Refer to GROUP 14 - REAR AXLES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: U-bolt nuts must be retorqued to 260-300 ft-lbs. (352-406 N•m) after 1000 miles (1609 km/h) and at regular service intervals.
